summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons count sheet and inmate roster from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 14, 2019, showing inmate counts by housing unit and specific assignments for inmates on suicide watch. It appears to be routine prison administrative paperwork from the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.

persons.name: English
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 78107-054, assigned to HOSP (hospital) and marked with suicide watch status on the inmate roster.

persons.name: Mersey
persons.context: Listed as an inmate with registration number 89673-053, assigned to HOSP (hospital) and marked with suicide watch status on the inmate roster.

events.title: Daily Prison Count and Assignments
events.description: Routine administrative count of inmates and assignment of duties at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York. Includes specific tracking of inmates on suicide watch.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: This document is dated August 14, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The document shows a total inmate count of 757, with verification showing 754, indicating routine prison population tracking.
Three inmates (English, Mersey, and Noboa) are specifically listed on the roster as being on suicide watch assignments in the hospital (HOSP) unit.
The document is part of standard Bureau of Prisons administrative paperwork, including count sheets and assignment rosters.
The paperwork includes multiple official count slips requiring signatures from correctional officers, indicating standard operating procedures were being followed for inmate accountability.
